    • Method Detail

      • getPeriodNumbers

        public static java.lang.String getPeriodNumbers(com.guidewire.pl.system.util.DateRange dateRange,
                                                java.util.List<java.util.Date> sortedDates)
        Return periods the given date range spans in a series of dates. The return value is a string, which will either be a single number (if dateRange.start == dateRange.end) or a string of the form - where m and n are indices into sortedDates.
        Parameters:
        dateRange - the date range that delimits the result
        sortedDates - sorted list of dates to search
        Returns:
        A string describing which dates are encompassed by dateRange

      • allDatesBetween

        public static com.guidewire.pl.system.util.DateRange allDatesBetween(java.util.Date start,
                                                                     java.util.Date end)
        Returns a range representing all dates on or after the given start date and before the given end date. If an argument is null, then its side of the range is unbounded. If start is on or after end, then then range is equivalent to the empty range. This is a pass-through to DateRange because PCFs cannot reference com.guidewire classes.
